intro: Baccharis phyteuma, commonly known as silverleaf baccharis, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, fluffy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
